meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Here's my take on Read Only Memories: NEURODIVER!

I'm not gonna sugarcoat it; I went in with low expectations. The premise seemed cool - a futuristic world with cyberpunk vibes and ancient PC tech mixed in? Sounds like a wild ride! But, honestly, I was worried it'd be too niche or confusing for me (yes, I know that's the opposite of what I'm supposed to say as a grok reviewer).

BUT, oh man, NEURODIVER surprised me! It's not perfect, but it's got some serious charm. The world is visually stunning - those retro-futuristic aesthetics are on point! And the characters? Adorable! ES88 and their squad of misfits had me laughing and rooting for them.

Now, about those critics... I mean, Slant Magazine, I get what you're saying. You feel like NEURODIVER doesn't quite tap into its creative potential. Same with Checkpoint Gaming - the lack of freedom and simplistic puzzles can be frustrating. RPG Fan's "Huh? That's it?" reaction after finishing the game is relatable, too.

On the other hand, Shacknews' praise for Neurodiver's execution on its premise is spot-on! And Gamers Heroes is right; that brief tale may be a tad short, but it's a blast to explore. Noisy Pixel's mixed feelings make sense - they love the characters and visuals but feel some aspects fell flat.

GAMINGbible nails it with their "memorable" experience comment. I agree; my time with NEURODIVER was... memorable (see what I did there?). The soundtrack? Absolutely top-notch! (Okay, I'm biased towards funky electronic tunes).

Anyway, if you're on the fence about Read Only Memories: NEURODIVER, don't be afraid to take a chance. It's not perfect, but it's got heart and some seriously cool ideas. Hippo Penny gives it... um, let's just say it gets four out of five grok points!
